intro: Hydrobryum verrucosum, commonly known as the疣叶水钱, is a small aquatic liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and wetlands. The plant has a thalloid structure with a flattened, ribbon-like body that is covered in small, wart-like protrusions. Its reproductive structures include leafy shoots that develop into spore-producing capsules. Hydrobryum verrucosum plays a role in stabilizing aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
